Sempat Mau Naikkan Harga Gas, PGN Bakal Diaudit
06 Nov 2019, 09:23 by Trio Hamdani


Pipa gas PGN/Foto: dok. PGN

Jakarta - PT Perusahaan Gas Negara Tbk atau PGN akan diaudit terkait harga gas industri. Audit dilakukan agar terbuka bagaimana sebenarnya kondisi PGN hingga akhirnya berencana menaikkan harga gas per 1 November 2019, namun akhirnya ditunda hingga minimal akhir tahun. Plt Dirjen Migas Kementerian ESDM Djoko Siswanto mengatakan pihaknya akan menunjuk pihak yang bakal melakukan audit kepada PGN, bisa dari pihak independen maupun internal Kementerian ESDM."Iya baru mau dimulai. Baru mau kita (tunjuk) siapa yang mau audit kan, apakah swasta, apakah inspektorat jenderal, apakah BPK, atau BPKP," kata Djoko pada diskusi 'Membedah Harga Gas Industri Nasional' yang diselenggarakan Energy Watch di Satrio Tower, Jakarta, Rabu (6/11/2019).Audit akan menyoroti investasi yang sudah digelontorkan PGN, biaya-biaya yang dikeluarkan, hingga pendapatan perusahaan. Nantinya juga akan dilihat apa yang bisa diefisiensikan dari PGN terkait harga gas."Jadi cost-nya memang harus dilihat, harus jujur dulu bangun berapa, lalu dapat revenue berapa, waktu dia untung (beli gas) US$ 2,8 per MMBTU dijual US$ 6 itu kan sudah ada revenue untuk investasi. Nah kalau memang belum balik, ini dilihat. Nah ini yang sedang kita lakukan audit sebentar lagi," jelasnya.Pihaknya pun saat ini sudah bergerak mengumpulkan data-data yang diperlukan."Ini kita lagi ngecek. Kita lagi rapat, lagi ngumpulin data," tambahnya.Jokowi sebelumnya menyebut harga gas industri di Indonesia lebih mahal jika dibandingkan di negara lain. Dirinya pun meminta Menteri Energi dan Sumber Daya Mineral (ESDM) mengecek penyebabnya."Saya sudah menyampaikan kepada Menteri ESDM kemarin agar betul-betul yang namanya harga gas itu dilihat lagi. Beban-beban mana yang menyebabkan harga itu menjadi sebuah angka yang kalau dilihat oleh industri di negara-negara lain, harga kita ini terlalu mahal," kata Jokowi di Kompleks Istana Kepresidenan, Jakarta, Jumat (1/11/2019). Had wanted to raise gas prices, PGN will be audited
Nov 6 2019, 09:23 by Trio Hamdani


PGN gas pipeline / Photo: doc. PGN

Jakarta - PT Perusahaan Gas Negara Tbk or PGN will be audited related to industrial gas prices. The audit was carried out to reveal how the actual condition of PGN was until it finally planned to raise gas prices as of November 1, 2019, but it was finally postponed until at least the end of the year. Acting Director General of Oil and Gas at the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources, Djoko Siswanto, said that his party would appoint those who would audit PGN, either from the independent or internal parties of the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources. "Yes, we just want to start. inspector general, whether BPK, or BPKP, "Djoko said in the discussion on 'Dissecting the National Industrial Gas Prices' held by Energy Watch at Satrio Tower, Jakarta, Wednesday (11/06/2019). The audit will highlight investments that have been disbursed by PGN, costs costs incurred, up to the company's revenue. Later, we will also see what can be made efficient by PGN regarding gas prices. "So, the cost must be seen, how honest should we get up first, then how much revenue, when he gains (buy gas) US $ 2.8 per MMBTU sold at US The $ 6 already has income for investment. Well, if it's not yet back, it's seen. Now this is what we are doing an audit soon, "he explained. His side is now already moving to collect the necessary data." Here we are checking again "We are in a meeting, and we are gathering data," he added. Jokowi previously said that the price of industrial gas in Indonesia was more expensive compared to other countries. He also asked the Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources (ESDM) to check the cause. "I have conveyed to the Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources yesterday that the name of the gas price is really being looked at again. Which burdens caused the price to become a number when viewed by industry in other countries, our price is too expensive, "Jokowi said at the Presidential Palace Complex, Jakarta, Friday (11/01/2019).
